00001 import os
00002 from os import walk
00003 from os import system
00004 
00005 # Atom format: (ddhhmmss, ip, port, protocol)
00006 
00007 class parser:
00008         ## Reads files in a directory, then deletes them when finished 
00009         # Also maintains a list of atoms.
00010         # @param self
00011         # @p The path where the file is located
00012     def __init__(self, p):
00013         self.path = p
00014         self.atoms = []
00015         
00016         ## Reads snort binary dump files. Files are deleted when finished being read.
00017         # @param self
00018     def read(self):
00019         info = os.walk(self.path)
00020         for root, dirs, files in info:
00021             for f in files:
00022                 file_path = root + "/" + f
00023                 os.system("sudo tcpdump -v -n -r " + file_path + " > asdf")
00024                 f2 = open("asdf", "r")
00025 
00026                 # Only want IP for now. Skip if not IP
00027                 while True:
00028                     line1 = f2.readline()
00029                     words_line1 = line1.split()                    
00030                     while words_line1 and words_line1[1] != "IP":
00031                         line1 = f2.readline()
00032                         words_line1 = line1.split()
00033                     if not line1:
00034                         break
00035                     line2 = f2.readline()
00036                     words_line2 = line2.split()
00037 
00038                     if words_line1:
00039                         timestamp = words_line1[0].split(".",100)[0]
00040                     else:
00041                         timestamp = "---"
00042                     timestamp = timestamp.replace(":", "", 100)
00043                     if words_line1:
00044                         protocol = words_line1[13]
00045                     else:
00046                         protocol = "---"
00047                     source = words_line2[0]
00048                     destination = words_line2[2]
00049                     destination_words = destination.split(".")
00050                     formatted_destination = ""
00051                     for word in destination_words:
00052                         if word != destination_words[-1]:
00053                             formatted_destination = formatted_destination + word + "."
00054                     formatted_destination = formatted_destination.strip(".")
00055                     port = destination_words[-1]
00056                     self.atoms.append((timestamp, formatted_destination.strip(":"), port.strip(":"), protocol));
00057 
00058                 
00059                 # Add a delimiter for EOF not elegant but it should work
00060                 self.atoms.append(("EOF","EOF","EOF","EOF"))
00061                 f2.close()
00062                 os.system("sudo rm asdf")
00063                 #os.system("sudo rm " + file_path)
00064 
00065     def get_atom(self):
00066         """ Returns the first atom from the list. If the list is empty, read files to add more back into the list """
00067         
00068         if not self.atoms:
00069             self.read()
00070 
00071         if not self.atoms:
00072             return None
00073         else:
00074             return self.atoms.pop(0)
